topics.topic: FWS: How to Build a Language

notes.note: Prerequisite: SANSK 1131 or permission of instructor.

course.subject: LING
course.course_title: History of the English Language since 1300

notes.note: Permission required after first week of classes.
Prerequisite: LING 1101 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: LING 1101 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: Two years Sanskrit or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: LING 4401 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: LING 4403 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: LING 4421 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: LING 1101 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: previous course work in Logic, Philosophy of Language, Linguistics, or permission of instructor.
Preference given to CS majors. If class is oversubscribed, non-CS majors will be moved to waitlist.
Prerequisite: two Foundation courses in Linguistics, or equivalent for graduate students.
Prerequisite: submission of honors thesis application and meet with the Director of Undergraduate Studies.
Graduate Students enroll in this level for Historical Linguistics.
Requirement for second year linguistics graduate students. Participants must enroll in a concurrent independent study with a special committee member, or a relevant workshop.
Prerequisite: Two years Sanskrit or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: COGST 3370, HD 3370. Graduate supplemental lab for LING 4436.
